title: Your Signature Tells What Kind Of A Person You Are. Here’s What You Should Know - Indiatimes.com
text:
Regi George Jenarius February 24, 2017 
Recent studies have found that your signature could give away the kind of person you most likely are. The study is rather useful in figuring out if your boss, flatmate or the random stranger you met on social media is a narcissist. 
playbuzz.com 
A December 2016 study conducted by the Journal of Research in Personality studied the signatures of 500 chief financial officers to measure several personality traits, including assertiveness, social dominance, self-esteem, and competitiveness. They also controlled the size of the names of people. Here’s what they found 
Those with the biggest signatures were more likely to be liberal with the truth. They also found a substantial link between the size of your signature and the social dominance displayed by men and women. They found an apparent link to narcissism as well; more so when it came to women. 
econlife.com 
Researchers from Uruguay, the Netherlands, and Curacao stated that the reason they were only looking at signatures and not handwriting, was because signatures were more a personal form of self-expression. There are more studies from the past to back up some of the recent findings 
A previous study from 1988 found that people who underlined their signatures and added exclamation marks tend to be more narcissistic. 
bodyodd.nbcnews.com 
Researchers in another study conducted in 2013 by the SSRN, a multi-disciplinary online repository of scholarly research and related material, measured signatures of more than 600 CEO’s, over a decade worth of annual reports. 
They too, similar to the previous report, found that CEOs with larger signatures had a more inflated ego, sense of self and disregard for others.
